channel.title: Kernel v.14.19.0.8 and distribute whonix 15.0.0.9.4
channel.description:
In the end of this issue [https://forums.whonix.org/t/virtualbox-6-1-whonix-15-aborted/9178](https://forums.whonix.org/t/virtualbox-6-1-whonix-15-aborted/9178) I decided to return to virtualbox v5.2 and try to solve clipboard problem and I found out several mistakes.
If I try to import VM from Whonix-XFCE-15.0.0.9.4 distribute I get this screen when I try to start VM ![Снимок экрана от 2020-03-27 23-43-37|571x67](upload://gFcMfykZeGgd4oUCyPVlIHMj10.png) at the same time If I try to import VM from Whonix-XFCE-15.0.0.4.9 distribute everything goes well and moreover clipboard works fine. Far more I have VM which I upgrated from Kernel v.14.19.0.5 (Whonix-XFCE-15.0.0.4.9 distribute) to Kernel v.14.19.0.8 (Whonix-XFCE-15.0.0.9.4 distribute) and of course clipboard doesn't work. If I try to boot from Kernel v.14.19.0.5 in this VM I stuck in this screen ![Снимок экрана от 2020-03-27 23-51-52|552x169](upload://sy3hzUvqEzBYZZekoPnvf67ysyk.png) . Something exactly goes wrong.
You should pay attention that import and clipboard works fine with VirtulBox 6.1 but there I faced with another so annoying problem which can't allow to work normal - ABORTED!!
Could somebody help me to solve this problems?

item.title: Kernel v.14.19.0.8 and distribute whonix 15.0.0.9.4
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
[1] At time of writing: Use Whonix 15.0.0.9.4 + VirtualBox 6.1.4.

That is the future. Make that work. Don’t look back / take shortcuts since that won’t work for long, likely causes more confusion, other issues issues, and is unsupported.

If [1] doesn’t work, all you can do is writing good bug reports / work with developers. See also: https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Support#General_Advice

Read full topic

item.title: Kernel v.14.19.0.8 and distribute whonix 15.0.0.9.4
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
I didn’t say that. I quoted exactly only:

I decided to return to virtualbox v5.2

And then said unsupported.

Therefore my statement was only about that - the old VirtualBox version.

darkrole:

Do you mean kernel v.14.19.0.8 unsupported? Because as I wrote v.14.19.0.5 works fine.

There is no kernel v.14. -> https://packages.debian.org/search?keywords=linux-image-amd64

There was Whonix 14. But Whonix 14 is also deprecated, unsupported. See:

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Reporting_Bugs#Old_Stable_Support_Policy

Read full topic

item.title: Kernel v.14.19.0.8 and distribute whonix 15.0.0.9.4
item.dc:creator: darkrole
item.description:
Patrick:

Unsupported

Do you mean kernel v.14.19.0.8 unsupported? Because as I wrote v.14.19.0.5 works fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Kernel v.14.19.0.8 and distribute whonix 15.0.0.9.4
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
darkrole:

I decided to return to virtualbox v5.2

Unsupported.

whonix.org – 1 Dec 17

Unsupported - Whonix

What do you mean by unsupported?

darkrole:

If I try to import VM from Whonix-XFCE-15.0.0.9.4 distribute I get this screen when I try to start VM

  • https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Dev/VirtualBox#.5Bsda.5D_Incomplete_mode_parameter_data_.2F_Assuming_drive_cache:_write_through
  • https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Reporting_Bugs#Sample_Non-issue
darkrole:

ABORTED

See:

VirtualBox 6.1 + Whonix 15 = Aborted VirtualBox
Welcome back! No VM should be capable for crashing the VirtualBox host software. That is a VirtualBox host software bug which is not developed by and cannot be fixed by Whonix. This bug can be reported against VirtualBox upstream. VirtualBox has various issues. The internet is full of discussions that lead to no solution. Hard to find good information. It is unhelpful to ask in arbitrary places about it as this only leads to more discussions which go nowhere. The only option is to find out w…

Read full topic

item.title: Kernel v.14.19.0.8 and distribute whonix 15.0.0.9.4
item.dc:creator: anontor
item.description:
I think that your issue with this particular problem (not the other one in your other thread) may be compounded by the Virtualbox version. This is because the difference in the branches: your host Virtualbox is 5.2 but Whonix is using the Guest Additions that are a part of the 6.1.x tree. I have noticed in the past that when trying to start virtual machines with a host Virtualbox version that is too far away from the version being used on the guests by Guest Additions, some strange problems can happen.

Read full topic

item.title: Kernel v.14.19.0.8 and distribute whonix 15.0.0.9.4
item.dc:creator: darkrole
item.description:
In the end of this issue https://forums.whonix.org/t/virtualbox-6-1-whonix-15-aborted/9178 I decided to return to virtualbox v5.2 and try to solve clipboard problem and I found out several mistakes.

If I try to import VM from Whonix-XFCE-15.0.0.9.4 distribute I get this screen when I try to start VM

at the same time If I try to import VM from Whonix-XFCE-15.0.0.4.9 distribute everything goes well and moreover clipboard works fine. Far more I have VM which I upgrated from Kernel v.14.19.0.5 (Whonix-XFCE-15.0.0.4.9 distribute) to Kernel v.14.19.0.8 (Whonix-XFCE-15.0.0.9.4 distribute) and of course clipboard doesn’t work. If I try to boot from Kernel v.14.19.0.5 in this VM I stuck in this screen .
Something exactly goes wrong.

You should pay attention that import and clipboard works fine with VirtulBox 6.1 but there I faced with another so annoying problem which can’t allow to work normal - ABORTED!!

Could somebody help me to solve this problems?

Read full topic
